question.long: Does warming up before sport prevent injuries?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of warm-up (typically before exercise) on injury incidence.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of warm-up on injury incidence

no.description: The literature suggests that warm-up does not prevent injuries

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that warm-up probably doesn't prevent injuries, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that warm-up may prevent injuries, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that warm-up prevents injuries

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of warm-up on injury incidence

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of warm-up on injury incidence, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of warm-up on injury incidence, but there are mixed results in specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that warm-up might have an effect on injury incidence, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that warm-up may prevent injuries, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that warm-up may have a small effect on injury incidence

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that warm-up may prevent injuries, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that warm-up prevents injuries
